meanings.definition: A long curved horn used by mountain dwellers in Switzerland.
meanings.sent1: The alphorns echoed through the valleys, signaling the start of the festival.
meanings.sent2: The sound of alphorns filled the crisp Alpine air, creating a sense of tradition.
meanings.sent3: The alphorns decided to have a musical competition to see who could play the loudest.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set behind the mountains, the alphorns seemed to whisper ancient melodies.
meanings.sent5: The majestic alphorns stood proudly against the backdrop of snow-capped peaks.

meanings.definition: A traditional musical instrument made of wood and used in Alpine regions.
meanings.sent1: During the celebration, the musicians played enchanting tunes on their alphorns.
meanings.sent2: Tourists gathered around to listen to the beautiful melodies coming from the alphorns.
meanings.sent3: The alphorns decided to form a band and go on a tour of the Swiss Alps.
meanings.sent4: The sound of the alphorns resonated like a call from the heart of the mountains.
meanings.sent5: The intricate carvings on the alphorns told stories of generations past.

meanings.definition: To play music on an alphorn.
meanings.sent1: She practiced diligently to alphorn for the upcoming concert.
meanings.sent2: The musician decided to alphorn a cheerful tune to lift everyone's spirits.
meanings.sent3: When the alphorn player sneezed mid-performance, the audience couldn't help but chuckle.
meanings.sent4: His music alphorned through the village, bringing joy to all who heard.
meanings.sent5: The way he alphorned the notes made it seem like the mountains themselves were singing.
